title: Financials Up After Blackstone Earnings — Financials Roundup
text:
Shares of banks and other financial institutions ticked up after strong earnings from one investment firm.

Shares of Blackstone Group rallied after the private-equity firm posted quarterly earnings ahead of Wall Street targets, and instituted a higher-than-anticipated dividend. Steven Schwarzman, the founder and chief executive of the firm, staged an unusual defense of its history and strategy during the earnings conference call, in an apparent response to criticism of the private-equity industry from Democratic presidential candidates.

Among Blackstone's peers, shares of KKR and Apollo Global Management rose in sympathy.
